title: 'Raw nature' of Norway's 24-hour golf course
text:
CNN Leadership
Lofoten Links: Coolest golf club with hottest light show on earth Updated 1813 GMT (0113 HKT) September 9, 2015 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Located 100 miles inside the Arctic Circle, Lofoten Links, Norway, allows golfers to play 24/7 for two months of the year. Hide Caption 1 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway "Everything is here," two-time major champion Suzann Pettersen told CNN's Living Golf show. "It's fresh, it's untouched. It's just peaceful." Hide Caption 2 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway This is a course for golfers -- and bird lovers. Sea eagles, grouse, oystercatchers, starlings, ducks, cormorants, gannets and eider are all local residents. Hide Caption 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway If you are really lucky you might even spot rare black-tailed curlew. Hide Caption 4 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Golfers can also see the large flocks of migratory birds such as pink-footed geese and greylag geese that fly close to the course. Hide Caption 5 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway The course is located at Hov on the Gimsoy Island, 285 miles along the coast from the city of Tromso, and offers summer packages with tee times starting at either midnight or 1am. "Just look at the scenery -- it's gorgeous," said two-time major winner Pettersen. Hide Caption 6 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway The course was built by golf architect Jeremy Turner, who has worked on a number of courses in Norway and Sweden. Hide Caption 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway There are two tombs from Viking times on the course. Hide Caption 8 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway "In one way you want to keep it a hidden spot but at the same time you would love to showcase it to the world," said Pettersen. Hide Caption 9 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Lofoten Links' website says "the sun can be your companion 24 hours." It's the world's only 18-hole course to offer this for two months of the year. Hide Caption 10 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Lofoten Links has been nominated as the World's Best New Golf Course 2015 by World Golf Awards. Hide Caption 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Lofoten Links also offers opportunities to watch the Aurora Borealis (Northern Lights). Hide Caption 12 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway The best places to see the Northern Lights is a sliver of the world that includes northern Alaska and Canada and bits of Greenland, northern Scandinavia and northern Russia. Hide Caption 13 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Before venturing into any of these freezing wildernesses, it's worth checking out the kp index, a measure of electromagnetic activity in the atmosphere. A reading of two or higher is considered good for Northern Lights spotting. Hide Caption 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway "I'm a proud Scandinavian for sure, but even more so a proud Norwegian," said Pettersen. Hide Caption 15 of 16 16 photos: Lofoten Links, Norway Where's your favorite course?
